content: hey friends and fellow crafters today
I'm gonna show you how to make a trophy plaque for someone like a friend or
lover or whoever you want to make it for anyways I've made it for my Halloween
game and if you haven't seen that we all dressed up for our Halloween session so
check it out if you haven't seen it okay yes so I made it for a Halloween game
really fun easy to make but very effective and the player really loved it
so let's hit the table and I'll show you how easy it was to make my plaque called
the golden goblet award alright crafters I'm gonna use these
Forks here these plastic forks cut the ends off there with a wire cutter and
then move those aside I've got these pearls for the eyes and I'm gonna use
model magic for my sculpt here and I really like it because it's just a light
clay easy to work with air-dry and so it doesn't add a lot of weight to this
through the plaque like maybe like sculpting wood so I'm just gonna kind of
do a face shape here get my mouth and eyes and push those beads or push those
beads in there for eyes kind of get the shape it up with the hands there and
I'll just let you watch what I'm doing here just really easy clay to work with
just all about defining and refining not the Goblin schnoz there I got my teeth
push them in the gums you made really starting to come together just a
scar across the one eye there pockmarks
now here I've got the ears so really want to pointy poking out from the head
and remember this can be against the plaque so I want to kind of really
sticking out all the detail on the ears there
pop them on the side of the head some damnit damaged ear there
so warts and here we go we'll let this dry up and
work on the rest now here I got a plaque at the craft store wooden plaque these
are really cheap to do and I drilled a hole in the back there you can see it
coming through it's it's slanted down so it'll be easy to hang it on the wall
right I'm just using the Romanian Brown on this just a craft acrylic paint water
down bit I'm gonna drag some darker burnt umber across it give it kind of a
old wood look while it's wet ice okay here I've done the the plaque on the
computer and I'm just using some lighter brown and some darker Brown around the
edge kind of make it look like old parchment let's be the plaque for the
award I'm gonna put some detail in the corners where the I'm gonna have some
nails sticking into it like it's plaqued like it's nailed to the wall so that'll
be fun and we need some cardstock here and there's my dried plaque so I'll just
put some white glue on the back spread it out and apply it to the cardstock let
it dry all right just cut that out nice stiff
backing
cool alright now we use a bit of black and do a little bit of damage on the
edges as well as where those nail holes are gonna come through okay this is how
it's gonna be set up and my goblin head is dry I'm gonna glue the plaque to the
front here I just use the head to kind of get an idea where to put the plaque
and just put that on there put some weights and let it dry okay now I'm
gonna use these technically may it look like it's tacked into the surface right
like a scroll tacked to the to the wood so let's tack that in at an angle fun
all right great really coming together now the gobble and I spray painted up
flat black and I'm gonna use this antique gold on it right and just a
really nice effect there okay now that's dry I'm gonna glue this on I'm use my
goop I really love it for you know non-porous surfaces let's put the goop
all around the back there get a nice bond and it's ready to go put
that on there and we'll let it dry nice and we'll do one last thing to this
before we give it away now and use this clear spray and I'm gonna spray the
whole thing and that'll protect it and give it a nice glossy Sheen so that's it
we're all done
